Description: Rim and neck sherd of Clazomenian black-figured pottery neck-amphora with handle root; squared rim with triple moulding on outside; interior glazed black with single band in added red below rim; below two reserved bands; top and outside of rim glazed with added red band on outer edge of top; exterior: on neck, black-figure decoration consisting of male and female figures, perhaps a maenad and a satyr facing each other (of female figure, face in added white and black hair with red fillet remaining; of male, head with trace of red hair, red beard and shoulder); at right, part of black handle root.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Johnston 1978 / Pottery from Naukratis: An Exhibition on the Occasion of the 11th International Congress of Classical Archaeology (no. 57)
Cook 1952 / A List of Clazomenian Pottery (p. 132, no. 39)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GH.118) (phase 3)
